meanings.definition: A feeling or guess based on intuition rather than evidence.
meanings.sent1: My hunches told me it was going to rain, so I brought an umbrella.
meanings.sent2: Her hunches about the outcome of the game were usually accurate.
meanings.sent3: His hunches were like having a secret superpower for predicting things.
meanings.sent4: Following your hunches can sometimes lead to unexpected discoveries.
meanings.sent5: Trusting your hunches is important in making quick decisions.

meanings.definition: To bend over or crouch down.
meanings.sent1: He hunches down to pick up the fallen pen from the floor.
meanings.sent2: The old man hunches over as he walks with his cane.
meanings.sent3: The cat hunches low to the ground, ready to pounce on its toy.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the heavy backpack hunches his shoulders forward.
meanings.sent5: She hunches her back to fit through the small opening.

meanings.definition: To push or jostle with one's elbow.
meanings.sent1: He hunches his friend playfully to get his attention.
meanings.sent2: The crowded bus made it hard not to hunch into others.
meanings.sent3: She hunches her brother to tease him during the game.
meanings.sent4: The siblings hunch each other in a friendly sibling rivalry.
meanings.sent5: He hunches his way through the crowd to reach the front.
